intro: Carinta matthewii, commonly known as the Matthew's carinta, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It produces small, linear leaves and has a short lifespan, often completing its life cycle within a single growing season. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
